text:
hey everyone welcome to pai's kitchen so the other 
day I went to dim sum and a lady walked out with a

tray of mango pudding which is a very common dim 
sum dessert and it's as always super popular but

then I thought you know that looks super easy 
to make that I shouldn't have to wait to let go

to dim sum to be able to get one of those and 
that's why I wanted to share this recipe with

you so this is apparently very popular in Hong 
Kong in Thailand you see a little bit of it not

too much but if you've got something similar 
in your country I would love to know about

it share it with us in the comments all right 
let's get started so let's first talk about the

gelatin which is what we're gonna use to set this 
pudding so I'm using powdered gelatin and now I

got a bloom my gelatin first so this is always 
something that you want to do and working with

gelatin is allow it to absorb and hydrate with 
water before you use it so I've just got here

some cold water I'm going to sprinkle the gelatin 
over and I'm gonna try to sprinkle it evenly so

it's not a big pile in the middle because if it's 
a big pile then you might get some granules in the

middle of that pile that doesn't have access to 
water the gelatin will actually be stronger if

you give it a chance to fully hydrate and then 
that's just gonna sit for about 10 minutes and

you'll notice it comes back and it's like this 
big clump of gel so while that is blooming let's

deal with the mango here is my mango which judging 
by its Machinist you can probably guess this was

frozen and then thought the most important thing 
is that it's nice and ripe okay so I find that if

your first mango Asian brands like brands from 
Thailand and the Philippines tend to be better

this is the ones that I found if you are going to 
buy frozen mango that's a Western brand just watch

out because I want to show you that this could 
happen and it can be an issue was an issue for

me when I was testing this recipe this one is 
sort of like your regular Western brand and it

works fine it tends to be more tart which is not 
bad but notice this piece right here like it's

super white I find that with these types of mango 
you get some under ripe pieces that are actually

a little firm and starchy and the problem with 
that is it doesn't blend so you actually end up

with little grits and you can almost see like 
this one still has skin on it bad no good so

if this is all you have I would just you know 
go through it and get rid of pieces like that

okay and maybe give it a strain cuz this type of 
mango also is more fibrous so if you want a smooth

pudding pass it through a sieve first before you 
move on with the recipe so FYI so with this mango

I'm just gonna add it to a pot and give it a blitz 
and I'm going to use my trusty immersion blender

which is perfect for this then I don't have to 
transfer it from a blender or food processor

oh I'm going to also add honey okay and I like 
to use honey as a sweetener instead of sugar

because I love the fruitiness of honey I find it 
really accentuates the the flavor of the mango

woohoo and if you are tempted to lick the 
immersion blender make sure you unplug it

first and don't lick the blade people do not 
like the blades I know this looks like there's

so much good stuff on there right now okay 
so to add some creaminess I'm going to add

some whipping cream which is sort of classic 
but if you don't eat dairy you can also do

coconut milk if whipping cream is a little too 
heavy for you can do half and half so now I got

to put this on the stove switch I don't have 
setup so I'm gonna get that set up so here's

our bloomed gelatin so as you can see it's like 
solid so now I have to dissolve that using hot

water what I'm gonna pour in is just hot off 
the boil water so I just pulled this off the

kettle you don't want to boil and boil and boil 
gelatin over the stove because prolonged exposure

to heat will actually break it down and almost 
instantly it is dissolved all right let's take

a look at our mango so I'm just gonna heat this 
up now I technically do not need to cook this

but I like to cook it because by bringing it 
to almost a boil allows this dessert to last

longer because we're using fresh raw mango there's 
bacteria and things like that that's on it there

are some fruits though that absolutely needs 
to be cooked and that's things like pineapple

Kiwi certain tropical fruits it's got an enzyme 
that will actually break down the gelatin so if

you're thinking oh maybe I'll do this recipe but 
with pineapple ya definitely need to cook that

alright that looks good to me I'm getting some 
bubbles some steam I'm gonna turn this off and

then I'm gonna pour in my gelatin mixture and 
also now that this is hot my gelatin say like

this wasn't completely dissolved for some reason 
I screwed up my hot water wasn't hot enough then

you've at least got this step to ensure that the 
gelatin is dissolved this is the most important

part of this whole thing and that is taste you 
have to have to taste it and adjust sweetness

and acidity I know for sure I'm gonna need some 
lemon juice but you know just it's good to know

where you're starting with Oh mmm that's good but 
it really does need you can do lime juice but I I

love the sort of fruitiness of lemon now when 
I did this recipe with the Western brand mango

I did not need any lemon juice at all because 
the mangos were quite tart so fYI one more taste

and I'm gonna make sure I don't double dip that'll 
also help you ensure that the dessert lasts longer

like double dipping sand this is why I'm doing 
this extremely inefficient method Oh perfect

absolutely perfect so go my god I can drink that 
okay so I love adding actual mango chunks into

this recipe but I'm using fresh mango for this 
because I find that with frozen mango you can get

away with it but just make sure if you're using 
frozen cut it down before it completely thoughts

because once it's completely thought it's so mushy 
it's hard to work with so kind of when it's sort

of semi frozen and it'll still work just fine 
but fresh mango is just a little easier to deal

with come on there you go and you can load this 
up with as much fresh mango cubes Oh No as you

like and maybe don't use the whisk for this part 
all right that's it let's put it in our molds

and yes I made tiny little mini ones of course you 
know me I love everything tiny and mini and it's

super useful because you know you always end up 
with a little bit at the end that doesn't fit all

the other containers and so these are like little 
tasters right so now these have to refrigerate

for I would say at least three hours you don't 
just want these to be set you want these to be

cold so if you can do this like the day before 
that would be the best thing to do and also if

you're gonna leave it for a long time cover these 
with saran wrap too just so that it doesn't start

you know absorbing garlic smells or drying out 
in the fridge all right be right back time to

eat look at this it's all set nice and cold nice 
and bouncy so now to garnish this very typically

people like to put cream on it and I'm just using 
the same whipping cream that I used in the actual

pudding look at that how pretty does that look um 
you can also use coconut milk or some people like

to use diluted evaporated milk sorry not daily 
diluted condensed milk so that it's a little sweet

I just don't think it needs any more sweet and I'm 
gonna garnish with some extra mango cubes which I

feel like I should have put in before I added the 
cream so it doesn't float around like it just did

but anyway look out you buddies and of course you 
want to go with a tiny little spoon for this job

oh I got a piece of mango too it's perfect it's 
silky and luscious but at the same time it's kind

of light so it's not rich in the heaviest and you 
can really eat a lot of that and that lemon juice

if we add it just gave it a little brightness 
so good so I'm gonna be here for a while so the

recipe as always will be on Pais kitchen comm 
when you make it send me a photo on Facebook

Twitter or Instagram and if you haven't subscribed 
to the show make sure you do so you don't miss a

delicious recipe like this when you do click the 
little bell icon as well so you get a notification

every time I post a new episode and if you love 
the show you want to support us check them out on

patreon the link is the description below and 
I will see you next time for your next series
Oh
